Articles.Content:
So... It has been awhile since I have shared a craft. Here is my most recent craft meant to deliver 4 crew members to a space station in Kerbin Orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I estimate that it could get into orbit around the mun but haven't tested it yet. I have noticed that It has a tendency to want to lean on launch so make sure you keep correcting for that. (Please report any issues if you find them)

Any questions?

Download link: https://www./?pl1u739e2cuytby

Edited January 27, 2015 by spaceman1999
Download added
Looks very nice! How does it glide? How much DV on the third stage? Also, how much RCS does it have? Please upload the craft file
Do you mind if I copy the idea

I dont mind if you copy, just don't claim it as your own idea!

Ill also check all of the stats (It glides well) and upload the craft file after school.

Download added!

I still need to check those stats...
Yeah thanks I made a cargo version, as well as a different version of your crew one with a slightly longer range and more compact design. Downloading it now!
I'd love to see pictures! Im currently working on an interplanetary variant that uses nervas.

Oh that sounds awesome! Later today I'll grab some photos of the two (Along with my 30-ton launcher, these two Pelican variants have become the bases of all of my in-orbit operations!)... How much DV do you think your interplanetary variant will have? My crew one currently has about 2km/s - 3km/s of dV when in orbit, so I could probably squeeze 5km/s out of it if I used NERVA's and a bit of part clipping
That's a lot of stages for a single crew tank. Are you going for theatrics over efficiency with this design?
Its more of Im a bad pilot and like some room for error Over efficiency.
